alert.note: Alert for Louisa (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 02 at 3:51AM CST until March 08 at 2:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Iowa River at Marengo affecting Iowa and Benton Counties. Iowa River at Wapello affecting Louisa County. Pecatonica River at Freeport affecting Stephenson County. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Iowa River at Wapello. * WHEN...From late Monday night to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Agricultural land near the river is flooded and water covers most islands. Water starts rising onto secondary roads in Wapello Bottoms. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued late this morning.
